body:
> I'm so sorry to be dropping bug reports like this!

Not at all, thanks for trying 0.35 out so soon and submitting these reports!
I ran into this as well (https://github.com/pouchdb/pouchdb/pull/5673#issuecomment-246186805), and have a repro. I'll submit a test case and hopefully a fix if I have time.
Unfortunately git bisect says the first bad commit is 173cfc0df75e84ed4303887741d18831ed0076c8 which is a lot of code ðŸ˜•
Good news! I have a fix. Will open a PR.

issue.title: Correctly deshadow re-assigned module functions

body:
> which is a lot of code ðŸ˜•

TFW when git bisect gives you the commit with a message that just says 'rewrite'...

Thanks @nolanlawson and @Benjamin-Dobell â€“Â have released 0.35.8 :metal:

Hmm, unfortunately it doesn't look like #926 addressed the issue I'm seeing.

I'll try get a minimum repro.

[Example](http://rollupjs.org/?)

I'm not sure this is _exactly_ the issue I'm experiencing, as in my case `src/materials/materials.js` is somehow ending up with the name `Material` even though it's only ever imported as `Materials` (plural). Nonetheless, it does demonstrate name collision behaviour between `import * as foo` and a pre-existing `foo`.

**EDIT**: I think there's something slightly wrong with the website, just cut and paste the entirety of `Problem.js` into the same field and the output will generate correctly.

@Rich-Harris Sorry, here's a much less convoluted [example](http://rollupjs.org/?) (I was working backwards!)

@Benjamin-Dobell I'd recommend opening a new issue to start discussion. Sorry for misdiagnosing!

That example you post seems like a good repro. You can also add a test case to the code, which would be extremely helpful.

issue.title: Correctly deshadow star imports when conflicting
issue.body:
As @Benjamin-Dobell pointed out in https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/910#issuecomment-246220533, there's another case where deshadowing was not working correctly.

If you do `import * as Foo` in one place, and then `import { Foo }` in another, then those two `Foo` declarations aren't checked for namespace collisions. In fact, the problem is with the `import * as Foo`, because `Foo` doesn't get added to the list of usages and therefore isn't checked when doing `getSafeName()`.

I fixed that issue; the two new added tests fail before the fix but succeed after. (In fact they throw an error if you try to execute them.)  Unfortunately there's an aesthetic regression in this PR in that it can too-aggressively deshadow, as shown by the fact that I had to change one of the `form` tests to use `foo$1()` instead of `foo()` even though the `$1` isn't necessary.

However, since this PR fixes the functionality at the expense of making the output a little less pretty, I'm still offering it up. Please let me know if there's a good way to fix the `form` regression; I couldn't find one.

body: @Benjamin-Dobell Thanks for the repro; found a fix ^
Have released 0.35.11 with the fix for the second bug â€“ thanks everyone
